snippet: As many as 250 touch-screen devices are to be installed inside old telephone booths, providing free transportation updates, city program information and details about local events.
abstract: New York City Information Technology and Telecommunications Dept will install as many as 250 touch-screen devices inside public telephone booths, providing free Internet-based transportation updates, city program information and details about local events; devices, created by a company called City24/7, will be placed in high-traffic pedestrian areas across the five boroughs.
lead_paragraph: As many as 250 touch-screen devices are to be installed inside old telephone booths, providing free transportation updates, city program information and details about local events.

headline.seo: City to Install Touch Screens in Public Phone Booths
headline.main: City to Install ‘Smart Screens’ in Some Public Phone Booths
headline.print_headline: City to Install ‘Smart Screens’ In Some Public Phone Booths
